title-group.article-title: A Computer Simulation Model for Investment Portfolio Management

abstract.p: The purpose of this paper is to show how some of the results of modern financial theory, embedded in the context of a simulation approach, can be used to develop a computer model to assist in the management of investment portfolios. Such a model can aid the manager in evaluating and understanding proposed portfolio policies, particularly policies related to risk. The simulation technique is shown to be helpful in enabling the user to deal with the results of capital market theory at a practical, problem-oriented level and in allowing him to extrapolate the consequences of alternative proposed policies for problems which are both dynamic and probabilistic.
